latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.

title: A bill to award a Congressional Gold Medal to Edward J. Dwight, Jr., the first African America astronaut candidate in the United States.
ai_summary: A bill to award a Congressional Gold Medal to Edward J. Dwight, Jr., the first African America astronaut candidate in the United States. The bill passed the House of Representatives and now the Senate. The Senate is expected to vote on the bill in the next few days. It would be the first time an African-American astronaut has been awarded a Congressional Medal of Honor. The medal would be awarded to Dwight for his contributions to space exploration and space exploration in the U.S. and the world.
